III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
Section (1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall, at a
Description minimum, include all of the following:
1

(b) The provision of emergency medical, surgical, and dental
care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Care agency is not taking appropriate action to secure
needed dental treatment for a foster youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 3, 2023.
Complainant stated she has had placement of Youth A since May
2022. She stated she took Youth A to a dentist on February 15,
2022, and was informed that he has 5-6 cavities, a temporary cap
on one tooth that needs to be removed and needs a root canal.
She stated the dental issues are causing Youth A significant pain
and headaches. She stated that since Youth A is a temporary
court ward, she is not able to provide the dentist office with the
authorization to complete the needed dental work. She reported
the dental issues to Foster Care Worker (FCW) following the
appointment and let her know the dentist office was able to
schedule the follow up surgery within a week but, to date, nothing
has been authorized. Complainant stated Youth A’s biological
mother is not psychologically capable of giving consent at this
time and his biological father has had limited communication and
FCW has not been able to obtain consent from him.
Children’s Services Director (CSD) was interviewed via video
conference on April 4, 2023. CSD stated Youth A’s biological
mother has been hospitalized with significant mental health
concerns and biological father has recently moved twice to
different states and it has been difficult to contact him at times.
She stated the agency first became aware of the dental needs on
March 15, 2023, when they received an email from the assigned
DCWL CPA Analyst. Complainant had also contacted Foster Care
Supervisor (FC Supervisor) the day before. The agency held an
internal meeting and developed a plan to address the concerns on
March 17, 2023. The plan outlined that FCW would attempt to
have the biological father provide consent for the dental treatment.
It was determined the dental office required that biological father
needed to be present at the appointment and could not just
provide consent for the treatment or the agency could obtain a
court order. Biological father has scheduled the appointment for
April 28, 2023. FCW has already taken steps to obtain a court
order in the event biological father does not appear for the
scheduled appointment.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via Teams on
April 5, 2023. FCW stated that the Complainant reported to her in
2

mid-February that Youth A’s teeth were in bad condition, and he
needed to see a dentist but did not elaborate. FCW stated she
was not aware that Youth A needed dental surgery until March 13,
2023. Complainant reported to FCW she was not able to schedule
the surgery appointment due to not being Youth A’s legal
guardian. FCW stated she made attempts to contact biological
father in order to obtain consent and get the dental surgery
scheduled but he was slow to respond. In addition, the dental
office was providing conflicting information regarding whether
biological father only needed to provide consent or if he needed to
be present for the surgery. On April 4, 2023, he scheduled the
dental surgery for April 28, 2023. Due to concerns that biological
father may not follow through, FCW has contacted the guardian
ad litem to start the process to obtain a court order to be used if
necessary. She is concerned the court may not grant the request
because biological father is willing to provide consent and attend
the surgery. The concerns were not brought up during the court
hearing on March 22, 2023, because biological father was
communicating and stated he was willing and able to schedule the
appointment.
Foster Care Supervisor (FC Supervisor) was interviewed via
Teams on April 5, 2023. FC Supervisor stated Complainant
contacted him March 14, 2023, regarding Youth A’s dental needs.
Prior to that date, he was not aware of the extent of Youth A’s
dental needs. He explained to her that efforts need to be made to
obtain consent from biological father first since his parental rights
are intact. The concerns were not brought up during the court
hearing on March 22, 2023, because biological father was
communicating and stated he was willing and able to schedule the
appointment.
Documents reviewed:
 Youth A’s MISACWIS health profile. Reviewed
documentation from initial dental visit on 7/5/2022. In the
treatment section of the report the box for root canal is not
checked. Report indicates a referral was made for another
dental provider for specialized treatment. Documentation
from periodic dental visit on 2/16/2023 received on
4/5/2023. The report notes Youth A needs a root canal.
 3/10/2023 USP does not mention anything about concerns
with Youth A’s teeth.
 1/11/2023 court order and 3/22/2023 court order was
reviewed. There is nothing mentioned regarding dental
issues in either order.
3

 Social work contacts between 3/13/2023-4/4/2023 were
reviewed. There were 8 telephone calls and one text
message between FCW and biological father regarding
Youth A’s dental needs. In addition, there were 5 phone
calls and one email between FCW and dental office. The
contacts document FCW was given conflicting information
from the dental office regarding who could provide consent
for Youth A’s dental surgery and whether Youth A’s
biological father needed to be present for the dental
surgery. FCW confirmed on 4/4/2023 that Youth A’s dental
surgery is now scheduled for 4/28/2023.
 The agency’s medical and dental policy states only the
parent of legal guardian may give consent for non-
emergency or elective surgery.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on the documentation
reviewed, the FCW was actively communicating with Youth A’s
biological father as well as the dental office from the time she was
made aware of Youth A’s dental needs on March 13, 2023, to
ensure dental surgery was scheduled.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
